public interface Buffer

Method Detail

getTextSource

TextSource getTextSource()
Return the buffer's TextSource.

Returns:
The text source.

load

void load()
          throws DisplayMessageConsoleException,
                 EditorException
Update the text source from the file.

Throws:
DisplayMessageConsoleException - If the file could not be read from.
EditorException - If an unexpected problem occurs.

save

void save()
          throws DisplayMessageConsoleException,
                 EditorException
Update the buffer's file from the text source.

Throws:
DisplayMessageConsoleException - If the file could not be written to.
EditorException - If an unexpected problem occurs.

save

void save(File file)
          throws DisplayMessageConsoleException
Update a file from the text source and, if successful, associate the buffer with the new file.

Parameters:
file - The file.
Throws:
DisplayMessageConsoleException - If the file could not be written to.

isDirty

boolean isDirty()
Return whether the buffer's text has been changed since the last save.

Returns:
true => the text has changed.

getFile

File getFile()
Return the buffer's associated file.

Returns:
The file. null if there is no associated file.

isUpToDate

boolean isUpToDate()
Return whether the file has been independently modified since the last save.

Returns:
true => the file has changed independently of the buffer.

getType

Buffer.Type getType()
Get the type of the buffer.

Returns:
The buffer's type.

getDisplayName

String getDisplayName()
Return display name of buffer.

Returns:
The buffer's name.

toString

Useful for debugging.
